intro: Marsdenia lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white flowers that bloom in the summer. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation.
